meanings.definition: To move or shake the body in a lively, jerky manner.
meanings.sent1: She shimmied across the dance floor with excitement.
meanings.sent2: He shimmied up the tree to reach the ripe fruit.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel shimmied up the pole to steal the bird's food.
meanings.sent4: The leaves shimmied in the wind, creating a mesmerizing dance.
meanings.sent5: The energetic music made her shimmied with joy.

meanings.definition: A dance move involving shaking the body.
meanings.sent1: Her shimmy added flair to the dance routine.
meanings.sent2: The dancer's shimmy captivated the audience.
meanings.sent3: The penguin's shimmy at the zoo made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The shimmy of the palm trees in the breeze was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent5: The shimmy of the tambourine added rhythm to the music.
